'''[[C. J. Cherryh]]'''{{`s}} career began with publication of her first books in 1976, ''[[Gate of Ivrel]]'' and ''[[Brothers of Earth]]''. She has been a prolific [[science fiction]] and [[fantasy]] author since then, publishing over 60 novels, short-story compilations, with continuing production as her [[blog]] attests.<ref name="che-progress">{{cite web | author=Cherryh, C. J. |authorlink=C. J. Cherryh | year= | title=Progress Report | url=http://www.cherryh.com/www/progress.htm | work=[http://www.cherryh.com Cherryh.com] | accessdate=2009-02-09}}</ref> Ms. Cherryh has received the [[Hugo Award|Hugo]] and [[Locus (magazine)|Locus]] Awards for some of her novels.
Her novels are divided into various spheres, focusing mostly around the [[Alliance-Union universe]], the [[Foreigner universe]] and her fantasy novels.
==The Alliance-Union universe== {{main|Alliance-Union universe}} The Alliance-Union universe is a science fiction [[future history]] series, in which the development of political entities and cultures occurs over a long time period. Major characters in one work may be referenced or appear briefly in another.

==Other works== ===As editor=== The ''[[Merovingen Nights]]'' shared-world anthologies are set on the world of Merovin in Cherryh's Alliance-Union universe. They are collections of interrelated short stories written by Cherryh and others. Cherryh's novel ''Angel with the Sword'' precedes book #1 in this series. *''Festival Moon'' (1987)âMerovingen Nights #1 *''Fever Season'' (1987)âMerovingen Nights #2 *''Troubled Waters'' (1988)âMerovingen Nights #3 *''Smuggler's Gold'' (1988)âMerovingen Nights #4 *''Divine Right'' (1989)âMerovingen Nights #5 *''Flood Tide'' (1990)âMerovingen Nights #6 *''Endgame'' (1991)âMerovingen Nights #7

===Other credits=== {{main|The Sword of Knowledge}} Cherryh did not write the three novels in the ''Sword of Knowledge'' series, but received co-author's credit because she penned a foreword to each.
